title: non-group-admin vs. group admin act inverted to intended behaviour
body:
### expected behaviour
if a user is set as non-admin and non-group admin, he/she should not see the "user" admin entry in the user's dropdown menu nor should he/she be able to change the storage limit.

### actual behaviour
non-admin + non-group-admin users see the "user" admin entry in the user's dropdown menu and are able to change the storage limit, even for other users.

setting the user to non-admin + group-admin, the "user" admin entry disappears from the user's dropdown menu, thus he/she is not able to change the storage limit any more.

summary:
non-admin-group and group-admin act inverted to intended behaviour.

### steps to reproduce
- log into owncloud server with admin account
- create a new user with non-admin and non-group-admin rights
- share a folder with the new user
- log out
- log in as the new user
- have a look in the new user's drop-down menu

-> "users" is visible

- choose the "users" entry

-> the new user can see all users but the admin user

- change storage limit of any shown user

-> changing storage limit is possible for the new, non admin user

- log out
- log in as admin user
- change the new users permissions to: non-admin, group admin
- log out
- log in as the new user
- have a look in the new user's drop-down menu

-> "users" is not visible


### server configuration
operating system:
ubuntu 10.04

web server:  apache2

database: mysql

php version: 5.x

owncloud version: unsure. installed via webinstaller.php on 10th of may 2013

### client configuration
browser: firefox

operating system: osx 10.7.3
